div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 458 Zemun, on the Save River opp. Bel- (959) grade, Yugoslavia, 1924 Burial: c. 220 B.C. (Hunter) Contents: 195+ AR Alexander III: 41 early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 5 ANS 1944.100.28888, Pella 3 ANS 1944.100.29456 ANS 1944.100.29459, Sicyon 1 ANS 1944.100.29643, Miletus 2 ANS 1944.100.32004 ANS 1944.100.31965, Sardes 1, Side 1, Tarsus 1, Salamis 1, Aradus 4, Marathus 1, Byblus 1 ANS 1944.100.35093, Sidon 1, Babylon 6, Ecba- tana 1, unc. 12) 39 dr. (Euboea 1, Lamp- sacus 6, Abydus 2, Colophon 7, Mag- nesia 3, Miletus 1, Teos 1, Sardes 3, unc. 15 ANS 1944.100.26655) Philip III: 2 tetradr. (Damascus, Aradus) Lysimachus: 3 tetradr. (Lampsacus ANS 1944.100.77466 unc. 2 ANS 1944.100.81589 ANS 1944.100.81764) Demetrius Poliorcetes: 1 tetradr. (Pella ANS 1944.100.13771) Athens: 1 tetradr. ANS 1944.100.24420 Eumenes I: 1 tetradr. ANS 1944.100.43177 Attalus I: 1 tetradr. Seleucus I: 2 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim ANS 1944.100.44934, Susa ANS 1944.100.73348) Antiochus I: 1 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim ANS 1944.100.45791) Celtic Imit.: 102+ tetradr. (types of Larissa, Philip II, Alex. III) Disposition: Belgrade 159 (casts of 71 Alex. types in ANS); New York 31 tetradr. Saria, NZ 1927, p. 11 Pink, Münzprägung der Ostkelten, p. 61 Newell, WSM, p. 187 † Hunter, ANSMN 13 (1967), pp. 17-40, illus. The provenance of this hd., under Noe 959 as south Serbia, is now thought to be further north at Zemun See also no. 447 above
